summary: This bill, the NSF and USDA Interagency Research Act, directs the Secretary of Agriculture and the Director of the National Science Foundation to collaborate on research and development activities. These activities will focus on advancing mission requirements and priorities for both agencies. This includes areas like plant biology, food security, rural economic revitalization, and emerging technologies. The bill outlines coordination through memoranda of understanding, collaborative research, data sharing, infrastructure support, and education initiatives, along with reports to Congress detailing progress and future opportunities.
